answers.answer: Here is a quick explanation:Fasting glucose of 103 mg/dl implies prediabtes [pre-hyperglycemia], but only by a slight margin. Your 1 and 2 hour levels also show slight impairment yet still in the prediabetes levels. These are the glucose test ranges:Normal is 60/70 to 99 mg/dlPrediabetes is 100 to 125 mg/dlDiabetes is above 126 mg/dlSee the thread below where I reference reading another thread on this forum on what lifestyle changes you can do to help yourself reverse this condition. Good luck
Where is the thread I don't see it
The thread is directly below this onecan I be diabeticBy holly245Where I reference the thread four belowPre-DiabeticBy phatkickr

question: I had a two hr glucose test done back in October, I just got a copy of my results can u please help me to understand what this means.....Fasting GTT result 103Glucose 1 142Glucose 2 135I don't kno what it means, thanks for any help!!
title: What does my glucose test mean?!
